alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 6:25PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM CDT, Emergency management reported localized ponding of water in the advisory area. Some county roads may be washed out or have water over the road. Minor flooding remains possible. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from thunderstorms on Friday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broken Bow, Sargent, Merna, Anselmo, Comstock, Berwyn, Victoria Springs State Recreation Area, Weissert, Westerville, Lillian, Gates, Walworth, Round Valley, Divide Hill, Pleasant Hill, Wescott, Big Oak Canyon and Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
